abstract.para: Discussion of all aspects of defining identifiers for entities, including generation strategies.

topic.para: Entities must define a means of identifying unique rows in the underlying database table. In most cases this would be served by the column or columns making up the table's primary key.
Usually the entity will also contain attribute or attributes to hold the unique identifier for the instance.

important.para: Although not strictly required in Hibernate, such support is semi-deprecated and should not be used. JPA does require the entity define the attribute or attributes to contain its identifier.
